alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 24 at 10:58PM CST until January 24 at 11:30PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CST FOR CENTRAL ST. TAMMANY PARISH... At 1058 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Pearl River, or 10 miles north of Slidell, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central St. Tammany Parish. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
